definition: Zhang Chunqiao (1917-2005), one of the Gang of Four
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
surname Chun
old variant of 春[chun1]
spring (season)/gay/joyful/youthful/love/lust/life
bridge/CL:座[zuo4]
Yao Wenyuan (1931-2005), one of the Gang of Four
Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
Wang Hongwen (1935-1992), one of the Gang of Four
Jiang Qing (1914-1991), Mao Zedong's fourth wife and leader of the Gang of Four
Kang Sheng (1896-1975), Chinese communist leader, a politburo member during the Cultural Revolution and posthumously blamed for some of its excesses
Peng Zhen (1902-1997), Chinese communist leader
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Hua Guofeng (1921-2008), leader of Chinese Communist Party after the Cultural Revolution
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Gang of Four: Jiang Qing 江青, Zhang Chunqiao 張春橋, Yao Wenyuan 姚文元, Wang Hongwen 王洪文, who served as scapegoats for the excesses of the cultural revolution
Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Lin Biao (1908-1971), Chinese army leader at time of the Cultural Revolution
